SEARCH
Package thijzert.chatty.server

Class ChatServer

java.lang.Object
thijzert.chatty.server.ChatServer
final class ChatServer extends Object
This is the chat server. It creates a new UserThread every time a new user is connected. Press Ctrl + C to terminate the program.
Author:
Thijzert

  • Constructor Details

    • ChatServer

      ChatServer(int port)
      Initializes the server.
      Parameters:
      port - the port the server needs to run on

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method of ChatServer. It reads the arguments and then calls execute().
      Parameters:
      args - the args for the program
      See Also:
      • execute()

    • execute

      private void execute()
      This method starts the server. It creates an infinite loop that listens to newly connected users. If a new user is connected, it creates a new UserThread.
      See Also:
      • UserThread

    • broadcast

      void broadcast(Message message, UserThread excludeUser)
      Delivers a message from one user to others (broadcasting).
      Parameters:
      message - the message that needs to be sent
      excludeUser - the UserThread that needs to be excluded
      See Also:
      • UserThread

    • addUserName

      void addUserName(UserInfo userInfo)
      Stores username of the newly connected client.
      Parameters:
      userInfo - the username of the newly connected client

    • removeUser

      void removeUser(UserInfo userInfo, UserThread userThread)
      When a client is disconnected, removes the associated username and UserThread.
      Parameters:
      userInfo - the username that needs to be removed
      userThread - the UserThread that needs to be removed
      See Also:
      • UserThread

    • getConnectedUsers

      Set<UserInfo> getConnectedUsers()
      Returns all connected usernames.
      Returns:
      the usernames
